title: Viridis Color Palettes — viridis
text: n number colors (\(\ge 1\)) palette. alpha alpha transparency, number [0,1], see argument alpha hsv. begin (corrected) hue [0,1] color map begins. end (corrected) hue [0,1] color map ends. direction Sets order colors scale. 1, default, colors ordered darkest lightest. -1, order colors reversed. option character string indicating color map option use. Eight options available: "magma" ("") "inferno" ("B") "plasma" ("C") "viridis" ("D") "cividis" ("E") "rocket" ("F") "mako" ("G") "turbo" ("H")

title: Viridis Color Palettes — viridis
text: viridis returns character vector, cv, color hex  codes. can used either create user-defined color palette  subsequent graphics palette(cv), col = specification  graphics functions par. viridisMap returns n lines data frame containing  red (R), green (G), blue (B) alpha (alpha)  channels n equally spaced colors along selected color map.  n = 256 default.

title: Viridis Color Palettes — viridis
text: color scales: magma(), plasma(), inferno(), cividis(),  rocket(), mako(), turbo() convenience functions  color map options, useful scale must  passed function name. Semi-transparent colors (\(0 < alpha < 1\)) supported  devices: see rgb.

title: Viridis Color Palettes — viridis
code: library(ggplot2) library(hexbin)  dat <- data.frame(x = rnorm(10000), y = rnorm(10000))  ggplot(dat, aes(x = x, y = y)) +   geom_hex() + coord_fixed() +   scale_fill_gradientn(colours = viridis(256, option = "D"))   # using code from RColorBrewer to demo the palette n = 200 image(   1:n, 1, as.matrix(1:n),   col = viridis(n, option = "D"),   xlab = "viridis n", ylab = "", xaxt = "n", yaxt = "n", bty = "n" )
